com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client

Class HasListeners

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.HasListeners
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChartEditor, ChartObject, ChartWrapperObject, ControlWrapperObject, DashboardObject

    public class HasListeners
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    This class provides event support like described in Chart Events.
    Most visualizations fire events to indicate something has occured. As a user of the chart, you would often want to listen to these events. If you code your own visualization, you might also want to trigger such events on your own.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public final HandlerRef addListener(String eventName,
                     EventHandler handler)
        Call this method to register to receive events fired by a visualization hosted on your page. Note that this will not work for visualizations embedded in a gadget. You should document what event arguments, if any, will be passed to the handling function.
        Parameters:
        eventName - The string name of the event to listen for.
        handler - The event handler to call when this visualization fires the eventName event
        Returns:
        A listener handler for the new listener. Can be used for removing by calling removeListener(HandlerRef).

      • removeAllListeners

        public final void removeAllListeners()
        Call this method to unregister all event listeners of a specific visualization instance.

      • removeListener

        public final void removeListener(HandlerRef handlerRef)
        Call this method to unregister an existing event listener.
        Parameters:
        handlerRef - The listener handler to remove, as returned by addListener(String, EventHandler).

      • trigger

        public final void trigger(String eventName,
           Properties properties)
        Called by visualization implementers. Call this method from your visualization to fire an event with an arbitrary name and set of values.
        Parameters:
        eventName - A string name to call the event. You can choose any string value that you want.
        properties - A map of name/value pairs to pass to the receiving method.

      • addListener

        protected final HandlerRef addListener(ChartObject chartObject,
                     String eventName,
                     EventHandler handler)
        Call this method to register to receive events fired by a visualization hosted on your page. Note that this will not work for visualizations embedded in a gadget. You should document what event arguments, if any, will be passed to the handling function.
        Parameters:
        chartObject -
        eventName - The string name of the event to listen for.
        handler - The event handler to call when this visualization fires the eventName event
        Returns:
        A listener handler for the new listener. Can be used for removing by calling removeListener(HandlerRef).
